newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - July 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - July 4.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - President Lee Teng-hui says Taiwan will never abandon its hope for peace.
Taiwan, Hong Kong establish systematic contact channel during meeting between Koo Chen-fu and Tung Chee-hwa.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - President Lee Teng-hui rejects "one country, two systems" formula, saying Taiwan is not Hong Kong.
Taiwan, Hong Kong officials can exchange visits.
LIBERTY TIMES - Premier Lien Chan says Taiwan can set up special zone to allow full exchanges with mainland.
Ruling and opposition parties to resume negotiations on constitutional reforms.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Taiwan Cement 's eastern Hualien project passes environmental evaluation.
Business tycoon Jeffrey Koo to raise huge funds to invest in Asia-Pacific stock markets.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - U.S. stocks soar on Fed decision not to hike interest rates.
Both sides of the Taiwan strait are willing to open more ports for direct shipping links.
